intro: Lonchocarpus stenodon, commonly known as the narrow-toothed senna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a legume, typically containing several seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for various animals. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and research settings.
